metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2390 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in mm/hugetlb.c in the Linux kernel before 3.4.2 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption or system crash) via invalid MAP_HUGETLB mmap operations. An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's memory subsystem (hugetlb). An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crash the system).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

notes.Note: jdstrand> linux-armadaxp is maintained by OEM henrix> as per https://lkml.org/lkml/2012/5/22/418 Hardy is not affected also, I couldn't reproduce this with test case http://marc.info/?l=linux-mm&m=133728900729735
